greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between largest prime power factor of n and the smallest number S(n) with S(n)! a multiple of n [taking a(1)=0].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: a(18) = 3 since 18 is a factor of 6!, 9 is the largest prime power factor of 18 and 9-6=3.
program: A002034(n) = if(1==n,n,my(s=factor(n)[, 1], k=s[#s], f=Mod(k!, n)); while(f, f*=k++); (k)); \\ After code in A002034.
A034699(n) = if(1==n,n,my(f=factor(n)); vecmax(vector(#f[, 1], i, f[i, 1]^f[i, 2]))); \\ After code in A034699.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 08 2000
ext: More terms added and term a(90) corrected from 4 to 3 by _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 22 2018
